description: From steatopyga, steatopygia +‎ -ous. Steatopyga is borrowed from New Latin steatopyga, from Ancient Greek στέᾱτος (stéātos) (genitive singular of στέαρ (stéar, “hard fat, suet, tallow”)) + πῡγή (pūgḗ, “buttocks, rump”).

adjectives.description: steatopygous (comparative more steatopygous, superlative most steatopygous)

entries.meaning: (physiology) Pertaining to steatopygia; having fat or prominent buttocks.
